enrich_metadata.label: Beverly Hills, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Beverly Hills, Los Angeles County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Beverly Hills is a city in Los Angeles County, California, United States, surrounded by the cities of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Beverly_Hills,_California

By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.

enrich_metadata.label: Monrovia, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Monrovia is a city located in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains in the San Gabriel Valley of Los Angeles County, California, United States. The population was 36,590 at the 2010 census, down from 36,929 in 2000. Monrovia has been used for filming TV shows, movies and commercials.

this beach is not really good for surfing. This beach is great for hanging out and relaxing. It is perfect for family and friends. It is great for boogie boarding.

attraction_reviewComments: We went on a tour around Hollywood Hills. The properties are beautiful but very secluded by trees or gates or just too far from the road. Several stars homes were pointed out in... read more
On a clear day, the Hollywoid Hills give views of city all the way to the ocean. Its seems as if everytime I go, the smog pollution is worse and worse. I guess the price you have... read more
We bought a bus to show us the place, the houses and everything and it was really exciting. But, the told us that they would make us go to Justin Bieber's House but he doesn't... read more
This was fantastic, worth the trip we went in a sports car tour, worth while was not expensive and we did cover a lot of ground. Driving up some great steep streets and seeing... read more
We took a drive through the Hollywood Hills and it was beautiful. There were gorgeous homes and some of the views were amazing. Definitely worth driving through.
Thought it would be cool to spend some time exploring the maze of roads and really glad we did. Amazing houses and lots of inspiration to take back home for some DIY. The right... read more
This is the place to spot for super stars or your favorite stars home and if you're lucky enough you might even see them. Open your eyes to spot them.
Don't get lost, but definitely go for a drive through the hills all the way to the top. Where a lot of the stars live, and where a lot of the craziest times in LA have happened... read more
Did the guided tour ... Well worth it ... Enjoyed the local knowledge and wouldn't have been able to do it on our own.
We did the Mulholland Drive rride from the vicinity of the Hollywood Bowl over to Laurel Canyon .The ride was very enjoyable .The scenery is vantastic .We had previously taken a... read more
Fun to get lost, find your way. Discover amazing large and tiny homes.
Amazing views and scenery, but the locals drive recklessly on the slim roads that allow only one car to drive through w the steep hills and sharp curves you can't see whats coming... read more
Ok, yes I was being a tourist with my "map" of the stars homes-probably outdated. Still nice to drive the roads, check out the homes. We took it up to Mulholland Drive (not sure... read more
If you have extra time while in L.A. Take your car into the Hollywood hills the roads are very narrow but the views are spectacular and the homes run the gambit from small to... read more
I'm an architect and the Hollywood Hills are excellent to see how the mid-level of the entertainment industry lives. Some of the houses are very dumpy and tired looking 60s... read more
This area you must visit on a sunny day - nice area with some spectular buildings owned by the movie stars and singers.
Amazing views and scenery, the houses are truly breath taking. Just a short drive from the hustle & bustle of Hollywood.
Nice tour around movie star neighborhood. Awesome views make it even funnier. If you feel like you need to watch and stalk celebrities then that's your place to visit!
This is a must see on a tour. Interesting to hear the history and lifestyles in the Hills. Good views of the area. Drive along Mullholland and other streets gave a lot of... read more
You have to see the Hills if you are in Hollywood. You would have missed out on what the "other side" live like.
Great view of the city. Roads were little curvy but worth the drive. Great tour of the homes of the rich and famous.
This drive was an amazing experience. I would highly recommend it for scenic views and a fun relaxing day, especially if you like driving. We rented a convertible so it was... read more
Unless you're a local, you should do touring the Hollywood hills as a drive, not a walk, because it's steep & directions are a bit crazy - GPS is very useful. The winding streets... read more
Interesting to drive through here, but you certainly can't stop and admire the view from up here very easily. Traffic now is unending. I don't know how the residents stand the... read more
The Hollywood Sign is what you think of, when you think about LA. I was not disappointed, we saw it via the Holllywood Boulevard. If you go onto the third floor you can get... read more
All the reviews talk about driving through the hills. Either the driver isn't enjoying the sights or he is endangering others. Get out of those cars, people!
